'''''Factorio''''' is a [[construction and management simulation]] game. ''Factorio'' began development in 2012 by the [[Prague]]-based Wube Software. It was released in [[early access]] in 2016, it will be officially released on September 25, 2020. An [[Indiegogo]] campaign in 2013 raised more than its goal, and early access versions have been sold on [[Steam (software)|Steam]] and other [[Digital distribution|distributors]] to raise further funds.

The game follows an engineer who crash-landed on an alien planet and must harvest resources and create industry to build a rocket;<ref name=Zabijte>{{cite web|last=Dobrovský|first=Pavel|title=Zabijte planetu průmyslem v české budovatelské strategii Factorio|url=https://games.tiscali.cz/preview/zabijte-planetu-prumyslem-v-ceske-budovatelske-strategii-factorio-238255|work=Games.cz|accessdate=19 May 2014}}</ref> however, as an [[open world|open-world game]], players can continue the game past the end of the storyline. The game has both [[single-player]] and [[multiplayer]] modes.

==Gameplay==
''Factorio'' is a [[construction and management simulation|construction and management]] game focused on resource-gathering with [[real-time strategy]] and [[Survival horror|survival]] elements and influences from the ''BuildCraft'' and ''IndustrialCraft'' mods for the video game ''[[Minecraft]]''.<ref name="reddit.com"/> The player survives by locating and harvesting resources to craft various tools and machines, which in turn create more advanced materials that allow for the progression to more sophisticated technologies and machines. The game progresses as the player continues to build and manage their automated factory-style system, which automates the mining, transportation, processing, and assembly of resources and products. Players research advanced technologies that allow them to create new structures, items, and upgrades, starting with basic automation and eventually leading to oil refining, robots, and power armor.<ref name=apg>{{cite web|last=Jauch |first=Daniel |title=Our Nation's Factorio Review |url=http://apgnation.com/archives/2014/05/15/2020/nations-factorio-review |work=APGNation |accessdate=16 May 2014 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140517121814/http://apgnation.com/archives/2014/05/15/2020/nations-factorio-review |archivedate=17 May 2014 |df=dmy }}</ref><ref name=IS>{{cite web|last=Priestman|first=Chris|title=Factorio Is A Machine-Fetishist’s Best Friend|url=http://indiestatik.com/2013/04/15/factorio/|work=Indie Statik|accessdate=16 May 2014}}</ref>

The current version of the game is formally "won" by launching a rocket, although choosing to ignore this goal and instead continue building a factory is possible, as ''Factorio'' is an [[open world]] game. Construction of a rocket requires massive amounts of resources, motivating the player to set up a sizable, effective factory in order to achieve this goal.

===Combat===
The player is concerned with defending themselves and their factory from the planet's [[Indigenous (ecology)|indigenous]] fauna, known as 'Biters', 'Spitters', and 'Worms', who become increasingly hostile as pollutant emissions created by the player's factory increase, necessitating consideration of the balance between the player's production and the enemy's aggressiveness. The player can utilize defensive turrets, tanks, and other weapons to eliminate enemies.<ref>{{cite web| url=https://www.rockpapershotgun.com/2014/07/28/factorio-alpha-review/ |title=The Lighthouse Customer: Factorio| last=Livingston| first=Christopher| date=28 July 2014| accessdate=4 June 2019}}</ref><ref name="content">{{cite web|url=https://www.factorio.com/content|title=Factorio – Content|work=www.factorio.com|accessdate=10 January 2015}}</ref> As the game progresses, enemies evolve and become harder to defeat.

===Multiplayer===
Multiplayer mode allows people to play together cooperatively or versus one another both [[LAN|locally]] and via the internet.<ref name="F4" /><ref>{{cite web | url=http://sandboxdb.com/factorio-gets-multiplayer/ | archive-url=https://archive.is/20141121161205/http://sandboxdb.com/factorio-gets-multiplayer/ | url-status=dead | archive-date=21 November 2014 | title=Factorio Gets Multiplayer | publisher=SandboxDB | date=1 November 2014 | accessdate=21 November 2014 | author=Rogers, Tristan }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Version 0.15.0 - Factorio Forums |url=https://forums.factorio.com/44505 |website=forums.factorio.com |accessdate=5 June 2019 |quote="New scenarios: PvP..."}}</ref> Factorio supports both [[Game server#Dedicated server|dedicated servers]] as well as player-hosted [[Game server#Listen server|listen servers]]. In the past, the game used [[Game server#Peer-to-peer|peer-to-peer connectivity]], however this was removed as more robust options were developed.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.factorio.com/download-headless|title=Factorio Headless download|website=www.factorio.com|access-date=2017-04-25}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.factorio.com/blog/post/fff-147|title=Friday Facts #147 - Multiplayer rewrite|last=Kovarik|first=Michal|website=www.factorio.com|language=en|access-date=2018-09-10|date=2016-07-15}}</ref> Saved world files can be seamlessly loaded in either single- or multiplayer. By default, all players on a server share technologies, unless a system of multiple teams has been instituted by the server host. [[Friendly fire]] is present. While the hard limit for players is 65,535 due to limitations of the SOCKET protocol, this number has never been reached; the most popular servers were able to successfully handle several hundred players at once.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.factorio.com/blog/post/fff-156|title=Friday Facts #156 - Massive Multiplayer|first=Tomas|last=Kozelek|website=www.factorio.com|language=en|access-date=2018-09-10|date=2016-09-16}}</ref> Players can share construction blueprints with other players on their server, via a public blueprint library.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.factorio.com/blog/post/fff-170|first=Ondřej|last=Majerech|title=Friday Facts #170 - Blueprint library GUI design and redesign|website=www.factorio.com|language=en|access-date=2018-09-10|date=2016-12-23}}</ref>

===User-made modifications===
''Factorio'' is designed to be customisable via [[mod (video gaming)|mods]] to create additional content, such as modifications to gameplay or re-texturing of visual elements. The developers offer an online portal on the ''Factorio'' website for mod developers to host their content. To help support the modding community, there is an in-game mod manager that allows players to quickly download mods hosted on the ''Factorio'' website. Modifications to the game are written in [[Lua (programming language)|Lua]].

==Development==
The game has been developed by a team of developers from [[Prague]] since mid 2012. The development team originally consisted of a single person, but has grown larger. Wube Software was created in September 2014 by Michal Kovařík and Tomáš Kozelek in [[Prague]], [[Czech Republic]]. To fund the game the development team began an [[Indiegogo]] campaign, which started on 31 January 2013 and concluded on 3 March 2013. The campaign raised [[Euro|€]]21,626 of the €17,000 goal.<ref name=RPS1>{{cite web|last=Smith|first=Graham|title=Factorio Trailer Looks Like A Fun Factory, Has Demo|url=http://www.rockpapershotgun.com/2014/05/02/factorio-trailer-demo/|work=Rock, Paper, Shotgun|accessdate=16 May 2014}}</ref><ref name=IGG>{{cite web|title=Factorio|url=https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/factorio|work=Indiegogo|accessdate=16 May 2014}}</ref><ref name=May2014>{{cite web|last=Kozelek|first=Tomas|title=Here we are|url=http://www.factorio.com/blog/post/here-we-are|website=www.factorio.com|accessdate=16 May 2014}}</ref> Following the crowdfunding success, Wube sold [[early access]] editions of the game to raise further funds. The developer credits the April 2014 release of the game's [[Trailer (promotion)|trailer]] as a significant driver of those sales.<ref>{{cite web| url=http://gamasutra.com/view/news/218280/How_a_single_game_trailer_turned_the_tide_for_Factorio.php| title=How a single game trailer turned the tide for Factorio| author=Mike Rose| work=[[Gamasutra]]| date=27 May 2014| accessdate=28 November 2015}}</ref> As of July 2017, the team consists of 15 members.<ref>{{cite web|title=Factorio - Team|url=https://www.factorio.com/team|website=www.factorio.com|accessdate=18 July 2017}}</ref>

Michal Kovařík, the game's lead designer, cited the ''IndustrialCraft'' and ''BuildCraft'' [[Minecraft mods|''Minecraft'' mods]] for inspiration during the game's development.<ref name="reddit.com">{{cite web|url=https://www.reddit.com/r/nerdcubed/comments/2c9rh7/nerd%C2%B3_fw_factorio/cjdtffh|title=kovarex comments on Nerd³ FW – Factorio|work=Reddit|accessdate=5 September 2014}}</ref>

The game was released in [[early access]] on 25 February 2016.<ref name="F4">{{cite web|title = Factorio FAQ|url = http://www.factorio.com/faq|work = www.factorio.com|accessdate = 28 August 2017}}</ref> It will be officially released out of early access on September 25, 2020.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Goslin |first1=Austen |title=Factorio’s developers think the game is ‘taking way too long,’ so they set a deadline |url=https://www.polygon.com/2019/11/15/20966724/factorio-finally-final-1-0-release-date |website=Polygon |accessdate=15 November 2019}}</ref>

== Reception ==
Ever since early access began, ''Factorio'' has received positive reviews from critics, notably ''[[Rock, Paper, Shotgun]]'' and ''[[Eurogamer]]''.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.rockpapershotgun.com/2016/03/07/factorio-review-early-access/|title=Factorio: The End Of Management Games|last=Meer|first=Alec|date=2016-03-07|website=Rock, Paper, Shotgun|language=en-US|access-date=2018-01-14}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2016-02-26-meet-factorio-the-wonderfully-complex-game-about-designing-factories|title=Meet Factorio, the wonderfully complex game about designing factories|last=Yin-Poole|first=Wesley|date=2016-02-26|website=Eurogamer|language=en-UK|access-date=2018-01-14}}</ref>

In mid-2017, Wube Software announced that ''Factorio'' had passed 1 million copies sold,<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://techraptor.net/content/factorio-has-sold-over-1-million-copies|title=Factorio Has Sold Over 1 Million Copies|website=techraptor.net|language=en-US|access-date=2018-01-14}}</ref> and in summer 2018, the game surpassed 1.5 million copies sold.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.factorio.com|title=Factorio|website=www.factorio.com|access-date=2018-09-10}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.ceskenoviny.cz/zpravy/finalni-verze-ceske-hry-factorio-by-mela-byt-do-roka/1645376|title=Finální verze české hry Factorio by měla být do roka|work=České noviny|access-date=2018-01-14|date=2018-07-23|language=Czech}}</ref>

In late 2018, Steam listed ''Factorio'' as having hit a "peak simultaneous players" in 2018 of between 15,000 and 25,000 people, placing ''Factorio'' in their top 114 games ranked by number of peak simultaneous players on Steam. At the same time Steam ranked ''Factorio'' in the "Bronze" category for sales revenue in 2018, placing ''Factorio'' in the top 100 games by revenue earned on Steam.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://store.steampowered.com/sale/2018_top_played/|title=Steam: Best of 2018|access-date=2019-01-13}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://store.steampowered.com/sale/winter2018bestof/|title=Steam Best of 2018|website=Steam|access-date=2019-01-13}}</ref>
